meanings.definition: The worship of idols or false gods.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe practiced maumetry by bowing to statues of animals.
meanings.sent2: Maumetry was common in the land, with people offering gifts to stone figures.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of maumetry, imagining toys coming to life as gods.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, some see money as the maumetry that rules all decisions.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the maumetry of fame, showing how people worshiped celebrities.

meanings.sent1: The golden statue was their maumetry, believed to bring luck to the village.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the evil sorcerer created a maumetry to control the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The maumetry in the temple seemed to frown disapprovingly at the visitors.
meanings.sent4: To some, social media has become a maumetry, influencing their every thought and action.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunters sought a legendary maumetry rumored to grant eternal life.
